name: Psychological Operations
description: Using behavioral psychology to influence, manipulate, and control outcomes in intelligence settings.

cards.title: Coercion and Persuasion Tactics
cards.description: Psychological methods for influencing decisions and altering behaviors.
bulletpoints: Apply social engineering techniques such as pretexting, baiting, and authority exploitation to gain trust and extract information
Use framing (shaping how information is presented) and priming (subconscious influence) to steer perception and decision-making
Leverage psychological motivators like fear, obligation, and guilt to increase compliance and reduce resistance
cards.summaryText: Blend social engineering, framing, and emotional levers to press targets into desired choices.

cards.title: Strategic Psychological Operations
cards.description: Coordinating large-scale psychological campaigns to shift perceptions and create division.
bulletpoints: Use propaganda techniques such as repetition, emotional appeal, and selective information to shape public opinion

Exploit cognitive biases, including confirmation bias (favoring information that aligns with existing beliefs) and bandwagon effect (influencing behavior through social proof), to manipulate adversarial groups
Deploy misinformation (false or misleading information) and disinformation (deliberately deceptive content) to undermine opponents and control narratives
cards.summaryText: Layer propaganda loops, leverage bias shortcuts, and seed disinformation to fracture enemy narratives.

cards.title: Perception Management & Narrative Control
cards.description: Shaping how individuals or groups interpret events to guide behavior and decision-making.
bulletpoints: Construct narratives (coherent, persuasive storylines) that align with strategic objectives and influence emotions
Use media manipulation tactics such as selective reporting, false attribution, and staged events to control information flow
Apply subliminal messaging (hidden persuasive cues) and neuro-linguistic programming (NLP) (language-based influence) to shape perception at a subconscious level
cards.summaryText: Craft emotionally charged narratives, steer media optics, and slip in subliminal cues to steer perception.

cards.title: Group Psychology & Mass Influence
cards.description: Exploiting group dynamics to amplify psychological control.
bulletpoints: Leverage groupthink (desire for harmony leading to poor decision-making) to push targeted narratives within closed communities
Use moral disengagement techniques (justifying unethical actions) to radicalize individuals and encourage ideological commitment
Implement identity reinforcement strategies, such as in-group favoritism and out-group demonization, to strengthen group cohesion and create division
cards.summaryText: Exploit groupthink, moral disengagement, and identity reinforcement to mobilize crowds around your agenda.

cards.title: Subversion & Psychological Warfare
bulletpoints: Deploy active measures (covert actions like forgeries, leaked documents, and false intelligence) to weaken enemy credibility
Use emotional exhaustion tactics such as relentless fear, uncertainty, and doubt (FUD) campaigns to wear down adversarial resolve
Exploit information overload (flooding adversaries with conflicting data) to induce confusion and paralysis in decision-making
cards.summaryText: Combine active measures, sustained FUD, and data deluges to break adversary focus and cohesion.
